musicalLanguage.description: The quintessential bossa nova, Jobim's masterpiece is built on a deceptively simple melody that floats over sophisticated jazz harmony. The A section stays in F major with Fmaj7 and G7 chords, while the famous bridge modulates through distant keys. The bossa nova rhythm in the left hand creates a gentle, hypnotic pulse that never rushes.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: Fmaj7-G7 vamp (4 bars), Bridge: Gbmaj7-B9 modulation (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The signature melody — just three notes (G-A-G) repeated with rhythmic variation.
Bar 5: Gbmaj7 — the famous modulation. Suddenly we're in a different world.
Bar 8: Return to F — the journey home from the bridge.
teachingGoals: Bossa nova left hand rhythm — the syncopated bass-chord pattern
Hearing the modulation to Gbmaj7 and navigating the key change
Maintaining a relaxed groove while playing jazz harmony
styleTips: Bossa nova is quiet and intimate — never play loud
Left hand rhythm is subtle — bass note then chord, gently syncopated
The melody should feel like someone humming, not performing

measures.leftHand: F2:q A3 C4 E4:q F2:q A3 C4 E4:q
measures.teachingNote: Fmaj7 — the iconic opening. The melody barely moves. That's the point.

measures.leftHand: G2:q B3 D4 F4:q G2:q B3 D4 F4:q
measures.teachingNote: G7 — same melodic shape. The harmony shifts underneath like a tide.

measures.leftHand: F2:q A3 C4 E4:q F2:q A3 C4 E4:q
measures.teachingNote: Fmaj7 — the repetition IS bossa nova. Subtle variation in touch only.

measures.leftHand: G2:q B3 D4 F4:q G2:q B3 D4 F4:q
measures.teachingNote: G7 — melody drops to E. The phrase ends, preparing for the bridge.

measures.leftHand: Gb2:q Bb3 Db4 F4:q Gb2:q Bb3 Db4 F4:q
measures.teachingNote: Gbmaj7 — the modulation! Everything shifts. New tonal world.

measures.leftHand: B2:q D#3 F#3 A3:q B2:q D#3 F#3 A3:q
measures.teachingNote: B9 — deeper into the modulation. The melody climbs to Bb4.

measures.leftHand: D2:q F3 A3 C4:q D2:q F3 A3 C4:q
measures.teachingNote: Dm7 — beginning the journey back to F major.
C7 to F — home. The rest is pure bossa: say it, then let silence speak.
